Generate fake data with privacy controls

Source: R/generate_fake_with_privacy.R
generate_fake_with_privacy.Rd

Generates a synthetic copy of data, then optionally detects/handles sensitive columns by name. Detection uses the ORIGINAL column names and maps to output via attr(fake, "name_map") if present.

Usage

generate_fake_with_privacy(
  data,
  n = NULL,
  level = c("low", "medium", "high"),
  seed = NULL,
  sensitive = NULL,
  sensitive_detect = TRUE,
  sensitive_strategy = c("fake", "drop"),
  normalize = TRUE
)

Arguments

data

A data.frame (or coercible) to mirror.

n

Number of rows to generate (default: same as nrow(data) if NULL).

level

Privacy preset: one of "low", "medium", "high".

seed

Optional RNG seed for reproducibility.

sensitive

Optional character vector of original column names to treat as sensitive.

sensitive_detect

Logical; auto-detect common sensitive columns by name. Default TRUE.

sensitive_strategy

One of "fake" (replace with tokens) or "drop". Default "fake".

normalize

If TRUE (default), coerce & normalize inputs (percent → numeric, mm/dd/yyyy HH:MM → POSIXct, yes/no → factor, blanks → NA; preserves "not applicable"/"no data" as real categories).

Value

data.frame with attributes: sensitive_columns, dropped_columns, name_map
